page.title: 09BEEF REARING: BOWERCHALKE
page.content: BEEF CATTLE FOR FATTENING Most farmers run a herd of 30 - 40 steers. These run on grassland until November, when they come under cover in a beef unit. Here they are fed silage and barley. Shelter is given at night only, from November, then 24hourly for 2 months, returning to night shelter in March. The cattle are sold at 18 months old. BREEDS are chosen to meet the modern requirement for lean meat - Hereford/Friesian or Aberdeen Angus. Where there is more natural shelter cattle need less time indoors. Feeding is supplemented when necessary.
